info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 7 at 12:49AM CDT until May 7 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Canadian River at Amarillo 19N affecting Potter County.
For the Canadian River...including Amarillo 19N...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Canadian River at Amarillo 19N.
* WHEN...Until this afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Dirt road that runs east alongside the river channel becomes flooded. This road leads to Rosita Creek Flats Recreation Area, where primitive camping occurs.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 4.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 5.1 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to 7.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall to 4.9 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 09/20/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON
